column1: Why did the time traveler give julius caeser a bj? he wanted to go down on history.
column3: down refers to both the action of going down and being remembered (or recorded) in history.
column4: The sun began to set as it went down behind the mountains.
column5: The scientist wanted to go down in history for his groundbreaking discoveries.

column1: Did you hear about that fire at the circus?! i heard it was in tents!
column3: in refers to the condition of being inside, while in tents sounds like intense, relating to the situations severity.
column4: The children are playing in the garden.
column5: The debate in the classroom became very intense when discussing the topic.

column1: If you throw away an ice sculpture, is it justice?
column3: justice can refer to the legal system or the concept of fairness, while also relating to a play on words about what is right or wrong (just).
column4: The court system aims to deliver justice to all individuals.
column5: It is a matter of justice to return lost items to their rightful owners.

column1: What do you call a gathering of nuns? A convent-tion.
column3: convent refers to a community of nuns, while it sounds like it could refer to a convention (gathering).
column4: The convent was located on the outskirts of the city.
column5: Many people find industry conventions to be valuable networking opportunities.

column1: What do you call a tick on the moon? A lunatic.
column3: tick refers both to the parasite and the sound, or a metaphor for time (like a clock ticking).
column4: The clock started to tick louder as the hour approached.
column5: The dog became anxious when it was bitten by a tick while playing outside.
